value:
Of all possible outfits, I somehow
ended up in this... Surely there is
something that would look better...

Don't expect a well-prepared meal
from me! Just...don't. You'll regret it.

Wh-what's with that look?! If you
have something to say, say it!

Rather than practicing walking in this
outfit, I'd rather practice with a blade.
One will help keep the apostle safe.

I am sorry to trouble you with this,
but...I seem to have lost track of the
apostle. Help me look, would you?

I am Tanith of the Begnion Holy
Guard. Ignore the outfit—I was sent
here by $Nf.

Now I can more fully...
express myself!

This wedding attire won't
hold me back!
Tch. How disappointing!

W-would you d-do me the
honor of— Oh, forget that!

I am Tanith, deputy commander of
the Begnion Holy Guard. This outfit is
due to...unforeseen circumstances.

My life's purpose is to protect the
apostle. I don't have time to dream
about the future—let alone marriage.$k$pThe apostle did, however, say I look
good in this outfit... And if that's true,
I'm happy.$k$pAnd I will hold your compliments
dear too, $Nu.$k$pVictory in battle isn't everything.
Sharing smiles with those you care
about is important too.$k$pI suppose this silly outfit helped me
realize that... So for that, at least,
I am grateful.
それっ！
ゆくぞ！
きゃああっ！
なんという…
Wedded to battle!
Love is eternal!
Love and war!
It's rude to stare!
Bury me in my armor!
Hehe
Do not let this marital attire confuse you. I, Tanith, deputy commander of the Begnion Holy Guard, am still an officer.
The lint on my outfit is none of your concern. Focus on battle, not bridal gowns.
It seems I must conform to festival customs on my search for the apostle, so I find myself wearing this…absurd outfit.
I never thought I'd find myself dressed like this… My heart belongs only on the battlefield.
What did you say? It doesn't matter what I'm wearing. My clothes are of no concern to you.
If this is some sort of misunderstanding on my part, then… Oh, summoner. It's nothing. Carry on.
I pledge my body and soul to protect you.
I do.
Yes, d-dear?
I will defend my union!
